channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋ビル・ブロックがミラマックスのCEOを退任。
item.description:
Matt Donnelly / Variety:
Sources: Bill Block is out as the CEO of Miramax after his contract expired this week and was not renewed  —  The executive and film producer was hired in 2017.  Block's contract expired this week and was not renewed, sources said.  He's been rumored to be out for months.

item.title: ゴールデングローブ賞は11人のメンバーを追加し、76カ国を代表する300人の投票機関となり、47％が女性、60％が人種的・民族的に多様となる（Jordan Moreau/Variety）
item.description:
Jordan Moreau / Variety:
The Golden Globes adds 11 members, bringing its voting body to 300 people that represents 76 countries and is 47% female and 60% racially and ethnically diverse  —  The Golden Globes has added 11 new members, bringing its total voting body to 300 people and 60% diversity, the organization announced Monday.

item.title: アドビ、ゲッティイメージズ、Stability AI、YouTubeは、ジェネレーティブAIの利益の一部をクリエイターと共有することを約束しているが、具体的な支払い額を共有しているところはない（Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Kyle Wiggers / TechCrunch:
While Adobe, Getty Images, Stability AI, and YouTube have pledged to share some generative AI profits with creators, none have shared specific payout amounts  —  As tech companies begin to monetize generative AI, the creators on whose work it is trained are asking for their fair share.

item.title: 情報源テッド・サランドス、デヴィッド・ザスラブ、ボブ・アイガー、ドナ・ラングレーが10月2日にSAG-AFTRA本部で行われる交渉セッションに出席し、早期合意への期待を高めている（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
Sources: Ted Sarandos, David Zaslav, Bob Iger, and Donna Langley are attending October 2's negotiating session at SAG-AFTRA's HQ, raising hopes for a quick deal  —  Four leaders that expedited talks with the Writers Guild of America will be present at the union's headquarters on Monday.  —  They're back.

item.title: 警察によると、フリージャーナリストのジョシュ・クルーガーがフィラデルフィアの自宅内で射殺された。
item.description:
Ellie Rushing / The Philadelphia Inquirer:
Police say freelance journalist Josh Kruger was shot and killed inside his Philadelphia home at age 39; Kruger wrote for The Philadelphia Inquirer and others  —  A Philadelphia journalist was shot and killed inside his Point Breeze home overnight, police said, after a person with a gun entered …

item.title: TikTokアプリ内のコードから、同社が米国で月額4.99ドルの広告なしサブスクリプションプランをテストしていることがわかる（Aamir Siddiqui/Android Authority）
item.description:
Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority:
Code within the TikTok app indicates that the company is testing an ad-free subscription plan for $4.99 per month in the US  —  For $4.99 per month in the testing phase, users will be able to enjoy an ad-free TikTok experience.  —  •  —  TL;DR  — Code within the TikTok app indicates …

item.title: パリス・ヒルトンと彼女の会社11:11 MediaがXとパートナーシップを結び、Xの「Live Shopping」商品を宣伝するオリジナル・ビデオ・コンテンツ番組を年間4本制作する（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Paris Hilton and her company 11:11 Media sign a partnership with X to create four original video content programs per year to promote X's Live Shopping product  —  Paris Hilton is getting her X on.  —  The influencer and entrepreneur — who has 16.6 million followers on X …

item.title: フィラデルフィア・インクワイアラー紙がミレニアル世代に向けた7桁の広告キャンペーンを開始、フィラデルフィアの5大スポーツチームすべてがロゴの使用に同意（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Philadelphia Inquirer launches a seven-figure ad campaign aimed at millennials; all five major Philadelphia sports teams agreed for their logos to be used  —  The Philadelphia Inquirer is launching its first major ad campaign in decades, its publisher and CEO Lisa Hughes told Axios …

item.title: ジェフ・ザッカーがニュースレター新興企業フロントオフィス・スポーツの少数株を取得、情報源：この取引は新興企業の価値を2021年末の2500万ドルから4000万ドルに引き上げる（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Jeff Zucker acquires a minority stake in newsletter startup Front Office Sports; source: the deal values the startup at ~$40M, up from $25M at the end of 2021  —  - The sports business outlet is now valued at about $40 million  — Zucker will become co-chairman of the company's board

item.title: スクープ元CNNのボス、ジェフ・ザッカーがフロントオフィス・スポーツを買収へ（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Scoop: Former CNN boss Jeff Zucker to buy Front Office Sports  —  Former CNN boss Jeff Zucker has agreed to acquire newsletter startup Front Office Sports, Axios has learned. … - Zucker now has a brand and platform that he can use to develop and license new documentaries and video projects …

item.title: カンザス州マリオン市長は、ギデオン・コーディ警察署長を停職処分にした。
item.description:
Phyllis Zorn / Marion County Record:
The mayor of Marion, Kansas suspends police chief Gideon Cody, six and a half weeks after he led the raid on the Marion County Record  —  Six and a half weeks after raids on the Marion County Record — and six weeks after warrants for those raids were taken back — Marion mayor David Mayfield has suspended police chief Gideon Cody.

item.title: 元Mirrorの社長デビッド・モンゴメリーが経営するNational WorldがMidland News Associationを買収、英国最大の独立系地方出版社の座を獲得（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
National World, run by ex-Mirror boss David Montgomery, acquires Midland News Association, taking its title of the UK's largest independent regional publisher  —  National World also bought technology solution Press Computer Systems.  —  David Montgomery's National World has bought Midland News Association …

item.title: シンガポールのテマセクが支援するSPACのVertexが、ライブストリーミングサービスの17LIVEを6億7600万ドルで買収する計画、17LIVEの2022年の売上は3億6370万ドルで黒字（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Vertex, a SPAC backed by Singapore's Temasek, plans to acquire live streaming service 17LIVE for ~$676M; 17LIVE had revenue of $363.7M in 2022 and is profitable  —  Singapore's Vertex Technology Acquisition Corp (VTAC) (VERT.SI) will buy live streaming platform 17LIVE Inc for up to S$925.1 million …

item.title: 10月2日にスタジオとの交渉が再開される中、2021年からSAG-AFTRAの専務理事兼チーフネゴシエーターを務めるダンカン・クラブツリー＝アイルランドのプロフィール（Nicole Sperling/New York Times）
item.description:
Nicole Sperling / New York Times:
A profile of Duncan Crabtree-Ireland, who has been SAG-AFTRA's executive director and chief negotiator since 2021, as talks with the studios resume on October 2  —  Duncan Crabtree-Ireland, the lead negotiator for SAG-AFTRA, will be a key player as the guild begins talks with the studios again on Monday.

item.title: 年間予算550万ドル、従業員28人、ソーシャルメディアでは動画第一主義を掲げる非営利の労働擁護誌「More Perfect Union」のプロフィール（Laura Wagner/Washington Post紙）
item.description:
Laura Wagner / Washington Post:
A profile of More Perfect Union, a nonprofit labor-advocacy publication with a $5.5M annual budget, 28 employees, and a video-first approach on social media  —  In behind-the-scenes planning talks, More Perfect Union played a role in the president's visit to a picket line.
